name: 學習評量（IB）
restrict: ◎第一階段限 國際教師學程-國際◎限國際教師學程-國際選修
description: This course guides students to investigate different assessment strategies and put into practice. This course is mainly composed of two parts. Sessions 1-8 are designed to construct students understanding of classic assessment theories, while session 9-18 develops students’ competence in designing performance-based assessments and criteria-related assessments. Students are guided to understand the mutually supportive relationships of learning and assessment (learning tasks, rubrics, constructive feedbacks). IB educators who take this course need to explore the alignment of learning and assessment in MYP/DP, be familiar with criterion-related assessment, and construct a concept-driven internal assessment.
goals: Demonstrate the competence in designing discipline-focused assessments.
Show the competence in developing assessment plans and items that are student-centered.
Display the understanding of assessment principles and related applications to facilitate student learning.
Present quality assessment artifacts which are involved with group efforts.
Show the mastery of skills in developing performance assessments that engage students to inquiry topics with interests.
syllabus:
This course guides students to investigate different assessment strategies and put into practice. This course is mainly composed of two parts. Sessions 1-10 are designed to construct students understanding of classic assessment theories, capability in designing test items, and competence in designing performance-based assessments and criteria-related assessments. Sessions 11-16 are designed to acquaint students with assessment methods in IB education. IB educators who take this course need to explore the alignment of learning and assessment in MYP/DP, be familiar with criterion-related assessment, and construct a concept-driven internal assessment.
